title: World's Largest Cave in Vietnam Son Doong Exploring Preparation
text:
By Windy D. Phong | Submitted On July 01, 2015 
A tour to Son Doong, needs a lot of exercises and costs US$3,000 for a week. This is quite costly compared to the other Package Tours in Vietnam as we all know Vietnam is a best known for being a cheap destination. 
This article is to share to you how to plan your trip to this special cave and also how to prepare for your coming trip to Son Doong. 
Son Doong Adventure Tour Working as consultants and guides for the tour now are Howard Limbert, his wife and other members of the British Cave Research Association, who were the first foreign explorers of the cave as identified it as the biggest in the world. 
The first day of the journey will be in Ke Bang jungle, starting with a bus tour from the company's office in Bo Trach District and a walk through Doong valley before lunch at a village of 8 Van Kieu ethnic families. 
That afternoon will be a walk along Rao Thuong Stream to enter En (Swift) cave, a 1.6-kilometer feeder to Son Doong and one of the most captivating caves on earth. The adventure team will set up camps inside the cave, cook dinner and stay overnight there. Just make sure you get good sleep as Son Doong beautiful cave is in the next day. 
With 150 individual grottoes, Son Doong stretches for around five kilometers with a dense subterranean jungle and several underground rivers. The tour gives you five days inside Son Doong to explore all the amazing things that you might not find anywhere else on earth. 
The entire group in a tour have to follow each other on a small path instead of spreading out to protect the floor of the cave and its stalactites, 
Tour Notices - The weather conditions are completely different from the outside, and there is always fog. 
- There are also snakes and tourists should leave them alone, - You might wonder what to do for a toilet for five days - The tour has strict toilet rules to keep the cave clean- A mobile toilet is set up at each camping site, which is an iron frame for you to sit on above a bucket covered with thick canvas - There are husks you can put on top of the waste after you finish. Don't put anything into the bucket except husk and tissues. Hand washing gel will be provided after that. - After each tour, the porters take the buckets out and bury the waste far from the cave. - If there are incidents like rock-slides or someone has a sprain, some of the visitors will have to help the patients back out because cell phones do not work inside. - Also there are valleys tens of meters deep and fast-running streams inside the dark cave. One can put themselves in danger by trying a new path. 
Tour Preparations - The tour is for 18+, One register to take the trip will need to answer the following 8 questions: 1. Your hearing ability? 2. You are using special medication? 3. If you have a heart condition. 4. Asthma problem?
